prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What are Edward's true and genuine thoughts, feelings, and intentions towards me?

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical extraction of all relevant data from the horary chart based solely on horary principles:

1. Planetary Positions and Placement Details:
 • Sun: 29°59′ Aquarius
 • Moon: 4°40′ Scorpio
 • Mercury: 7°12′ Pisces
 • Venus: 8°18′ Aries
 • Mars: 17°13′ Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter: 11°36′ Gemini
 • Saturn: 19°24′ Pisces
 • Uranus: 23°24′ Taurus
 • Neptune: 28°31′ Pisces
 • Pluto: 2°35′ Aquarius
 • North Node: 28°56′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron: 20°07′ Aries
 • Ascendant: 8°54′ Capricorn
 • Midheaven (MC): 4°59′ Scorpio
 • Imum Coeli (IC): 4°59′ Taurus

2. Major Aspects with Orbs:
 • Venus square Ascendant (orb 0°)
 • MC opposition IC (orb 0°)
 • Moon opposition IC (orb 0°)
 • Neptune conjunction North Node (orb 0°)
 • Moon conjunction MC (orb 0°)
 • Mercury sextile Ascendant (orb 1°)
 • Pluto square IC (orb 2°)
 • Pluto square MC (orb 2°)
 • Moon square Pluto (orb 2°)
 • Mars trine Saturn (orb 2°)
 • Venus sextile Jupiter (orb 3°)
 • Mercury sextile IC (orb 3°)
 • Mars square Chiron (orb 3°)
 • Mercury trine MC (orb 3°)
 • Moon trine Mercury (orb 3°)
 • Ascendant sextile MC (orb 4°)
 • Pluto sextile North Node (orb 4°)
 • Saturn sextile Uranus (orb 4°)
 • Moon sextile Ascendant (orb 4°)
 • Mercury square Jupiter (orb 4°)
 • Ascendant trine IC (orb 4°)
 • Uranus sextile Neptune (orb 5°)
 • Sun sextile IC (orb 5°)
 • Sun trine MC (orb 5°)
 • Sun trine Moon (orb 5°)
 • Mars sextile Uranus (orb 6°)
 • Venus sextile Pluto (orb 6°)
 • Sun square Uranus (orb 6°)

3. Pattern Configurations:
 • T-Square Pattern:
  – Involves MC at 4° Scorpio, Pluto at 2° Aquarius, IC at 4° Taurus, with the Moon at 4° Scorpio
 • Cradle Pattern:
  – Involves the Moon (4° Scorpio), IC (4° Taurus), Mercury (7° Pisces), Ascendant (8°54′ Capricorn), and MC (4° Scorpio)

4. Special Chart Features:
 • The Moon is a waning gibbous.
 • Overall chart structure forms a Bucket shape.
 • Inner planet emphasis: Water element dominant.
 • Inner planets show an even distribution among the three modes (Cardinal, Mutable, Fixed).
 • Majority of inner planets are located in the bottom hemisphere.
 • Mars is descending.
 • The Moon is on the Midheaven and IC is on the Nadir.
 • The sextile aspect appears most frequently (total of 11 times).
 • The Sun forms 10 aspects.
 • Neptune in Pisces is positioned in its rulership.

5. House Placements:
 • 1st House (Ascendant): Starts at 8° Capricorn – contains Pluto
 • 2nd House: Starts at 17° Aquarius – contains Sun, Mercury, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node
 • 3rd House: Starts at 3° Aries – contains Venus and Chiron
 • 4th House: Starts at 4° Taurus – contains Uranus
 • 5th House: Starts at 25° Taurus – contains Jupiter
 • 6th House: Starts at 14° Gemini
 • 7th House: Starts at 8° Cancer – contains Mars
 • 8th House: Starts at 17° Leo
 • 9th House: Starts at 3° Libra
 • 10th House (MC): Starts at 4° Scorpio – contains Moon
 • 11th House: Starts at 25° Scorpio
 • 12th House: Starts at 14° Sagittarius

This compilation reflects the primary, factual chart data using horary principles and serves as a basis for further interpretative work regarding Edward's true thoughts, feelings, and intentions as shown by the chart.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to next steps.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood – Step Two: Raw Analytical Framework Applied to Edward's Significators

• Significators for the Question:
 – The chart’s overall tone centers on a relationship query. For Edward’s internal state, note that key indicators include the 7th house and its ruler, as well as prominent aspects affecting his personal planets.
 – With Mars located in the 7th house (in Cancer, retrograde), his active impulses regarding relationships are guarded and internalized.
 – The Moon, strongly emphasized on the Midheaven (4°59′ Scorpio) and in direct aspect to relationship-signifying factors, represents deep emotional processing that is both public and internal.

• Core Planetary Activations and Their Implications:
 – Moon in Scorpio, conjunct the MC and opposing the IC, signals pronounced emotional intensity with a tendency toward undercurrents of secrecy and latent power struggles.
 – Venus in Aries (in the 3rd house) denotes a direct, assertive approach potentially tempered by impulse. It suggests that his attractions are immediate and raw but may lack steady consistency.
 – Mercury in Pisces (in the 2nd house) introduces an element of emotional intuition and sensitivity in his thought processes; however, the square with Jupiter (orb 4°) hints at occasional over-ideation or mental conflict.
 – Mars retrograde in Cancer underlines hesitation in acting on his desires, indicating that his intentions may be subject to internal review and protectionism.
 – Pluto’s hard aspects (square to both MC and IC, Moon square Pluto) imply transformative forces at work. These suggest that Edward’s feelings are intense and may involve issues of control, deep-seated insecurity, or a drive for personal transformation.
 – Neptune’s conjunction with the North Node in Pisces brings a note of idealism or possible confusion. This placement warns of potential self-deception or over-idealization regarding the relationship.

• Pattern Configurations and Their Influence:
 – The T-Square involving the MC (Moon, 4° Scorpio), Pluto (2° Aquarius), and IC (4° Taurus) emphasizes an inherent tension between his public persona and private emotional needs. This dynamic often points to inner conflict that colors his visible behavior and hidden aspirations.
 – The Cradle pattern (incorporating the Moon, IC, Mercury, Ascendant, and MC) further suggests that his emotional and communicative processes are interlinked, with an inherent protective quality that might hold him back from full disclosure of his intentions.

• House Considerations:
 – The 7th house in Cancer, containing Mars, naturally aligns with his approach to committed personal bonds. The retrograde nature of Mars and its position in a sensitive, emotionally charged sign underline his guarded attitude.
 – The concentration of inner planets in the bottom hemisphere reinforces that his core emotional drives and internalized processes are the main influencers on his thoughts and feelings.
 – The balance seen in the outer aspects (such as the sextiles among Mercury, Ascendant, and MC) indicates that while there is friction from the T-Square, there is also capacity for communication and integration of his complex emotions.

Next Steps:
 • Use these extracted data points to identify and weigh the specific indicators of Edward’s true internal attitudes. Detail further which aspects reinforce internal conflict (e.g., the Moon–Pluto square, the T-Square dynamic) versus those supporting assertive expression (Venus in Aries and Mercury’s supportive aspects).
 • Confirm the relative strength of the activations by noting the precise orb sizes (notably, the 0° aspects involving Venus square Ascendant, Moon opposition IC, and Moon conjunction MC stress immediate energies).
 • Cross-reference the dominant Water element in his inner planets with his placement of Mars and Moon to assess whether his actions are driven more by impulse or by deeper emotional inertia.

The above synthesis forms the raw factual basis required for a nuanced interpretation of Edward’s underlying thoughts, feelings, and intentions. Provide confirmation when you are ready to proceed to the full contextual analysis.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Please proceed to the full contextual analysis.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood – Full Contextual Analysis of Edward’s Internal State

Based on the factual data extracted from the chart, here is a step‐by‐step analysis of Edward's underlying thoughts, feelings, and intentions:

1. Emotional Landscape and Inner Conflict
 • The Moon in Scorpio is centrally placed on the Midheaven at 4°59′, underscoring deep emotional intensity and hidden layers of passion. Its square to Pluto (orb 2°) indicates power struggles, transformative internal forces, and potentially self-destructive impulses.
 • The Moon’s opposition to the Imum Coeli (IC, 4°59′ Taurus) reinforces an internal conflict between what Edward displays publicly and the private feelings buried beneath. This opposition suggests he may project a composed facade while concealing turbulent emotions.

2. Action and Desire Modulated by Hesitation
 • Mars, positioned in the 7th House in Cancer and retrograde, signifies that while there is an underlying drive for connection, his approach to action in relationships is cautious and self-protective. The retrograde motion implies that his impulses are turned inward, subject to constant reevaluation, and possibly marred by hesitancy or uncertainty.
 • Venus in Aries in the 3rd House expresses an impulsive, direct manner of attraction. This placement hints that intellectually and communicatively, his affections are immediate and self-assertive. However, the overall combination with retrograde Mars suggests that even when attraction is felt, acting on it may be complicated by conflicting inner dynamics.

3. Communication and Idealism
 • Mercury in Pisces (located in the 2nd House) points to a communication style that blends intuition with emotional depth. Yet, the square between Mercury and Jupiter (orb 4°) introduces a measure of over-ideation—his thoughts may sometimes exaggerate or romanticize the connection, creating idealized expectations rather than grounded clarity.
 • Neptune’s conjunction with the North Node in Pisces heightens the idealistic or even illusory lens through which he might view relational matters. This influence can lead to confusion or self-deception regarding his true intentions, especially when combined with the pervasive dreamy quality of Pisces.

4. Transformative Forces and Relational Tension
 • Pluto's hard aspects (squared to both the MC and IC, and forming a square with the Moon) evoke potent transformative energy. This influence not only intensifies his emotional undercurrents but also hints at a desire for control or a need to undergo personal transformation before fully engaging in intimate relationships.
 • The presence of a T-Square—comprising the MC (Moon), Pluto, and IC—accentuates a dynamic tension between public persona and private vulnerability. Edward’s true feelings are likely multifaceted, reflecting a struggle between a desire for expressive connection and a fear of the vulnerability that such connection entails.

5. Pattern Indicators and Overall Chart Tone
 • The Cradle pattern (involving the Moon, IC, Mercury, Ascendant, and MC) suggests that despite the underlying intensity, there is an element of protection and caution. This configuration indicates that while his inner emotional machinery is active, it is also carefully guarded.
 • A dominant Water element among the inner planets reinforces that his feelings are highly intuitive, deeply emotional, and prone to being influenced by subconscious drives or hidden motivations.
 • The overall placement of most inner planets in the bottom hemisphere suggests that Edward's internal life—his feelings and intentions—are given greater weight than his outward expressions. He may struggle to synchronize his internal passions with overt, decisive actions.

6. Synthesis of Edward’s Internal State
 • Edward experiences powerful, transformative emotions that are not readily apparent due to a practiced public reserve.
 • There is an inner tug-of-war: while his Venus in Aries propels a raw and assertive attraction, his retrograde Mars in Cancer and powerful Pluto dynamics hold him back, instilling hesitancy and inward focus.
 • His internal narrative is marked by intense idealism (Mercury and Neptune in Pisces) that may occasionally blur the lines between genuine feeling and fantasy.
 • Overall, Edward’s true thoughts and intentions are complicated by a dichotomy between direct, even impulsive attraction on one hand, and deeper, perhaps darker internal conflicts on the other. His feelings are significant and layered, yet his actions are shadowed by uncertainty and the need for self-protection.

This analysis is based solely on the horary data provided. Each indicator contributes to a picture of a man whose internal reality is deeply passionate and transformative but hampered by internal hesitations and a propensity for idealization.

Madame Esmeralda Blackwood – Full Contextual Analysis of Edward’s Internal State

Based on the factual data extracted from the chart, here is a step‐by‐step analysis of Edward's underlying thoughts, feelings, and intentions:

1. Emotional Landscape and Inner Conflict
 • The Moon in Scorpio is centrally placed on the Midheaven at 4°59′, underscoring deep emotional intensity and hidden layers of passion. Its square to Pluto (orb 2°) indicates power struggles, transformative internal forces, and potentially self-destructive impulses.
 • The Moon’s opposition to the Imum Coeli (IC, 4°59′ Taurus) reinforces an internal conflict between what Edward displays publicly and the private feelings buried beneath. This opposition suggests he may project a composed facade while concealing turbulent emotions.

2. Action and Desire Modulated by Hesitation
 • Mars, positioned in the 7th House in Cancer and retrograde, signifies that while there is an underlying drive for connection, his approach to action in relationships is cautious and self-protective. The retrograde motion implies that his impulses are turned inward, subject to constant reevaluation, and possibly marred by hesitancy or uncertainty.
 • Venus in Aries in the 3rd House expresses an impulsive, direct manner of attraction. This placement hints that intellectually and communicatively, his affections are immediate and self-assertive. However, the overall combination with retrograde Mars suggests that even when attraction is felt, acting on it may be complicated by conflicting inner dynamics.

3. Communication and Idealism
 • Mercury in Pisces (located in the 2nd House) points to a communication style that blends intuition with emotional depth. Yet, the square between Mercury and Jupiter (orb 4°) introduces a measure of over-ideation—his thoughts may sometimes exaggerate or romanticize the connection, creating idealized expectations rather than grounded clarity.
 • Neptune’s conjunction with the North Node in Pisces heightens the idealistic or even illusory lens through which he might view relational matters. This influence can lead to confusion or self-deception regarding his true intentions, especially when combined with the pervasive dreamy quality of Pisces.

4. Transformative Forces and Relational Tension
 • Pluto's hard aspects (squared to both the MC and IC, and forming a square with the Moon) evoke potent transformative energy. This influence not only intensifies his emotional undercurrents but also hints at a desire for control or a need to undergo personal transformation before fully engaging in intimate relationships.
 • The presence of a T-Square—comprising the MC (Moon), Pluto, and IC—accentuates a dynamic tension between public persona and private vulnerability. Edward’s true feelings are likely multifaceted, reflecting a struggle between a desire for expressive connection and a fear of the vulnerability that such connection entails.

5. Pattern Indicators and Overall Chart Tone
 • The Cradle pattern (involving the Moon, IC, Mercury, Ascendant, and MC) suggests that despite the underlying intensity, there is an element of protection and caution. This configuration indicates that while his inner emotional machinery is active, it is also carefully guarded.
 • A dominant Water element among the inner planets reinforces that his feelings are highly intuitive, deeply emotional, and prone to being influenced by subconscious drives or hidden motivations.
 • The overall placement of most inner planets in the bottom hemisphere suggests that Edward's internal life—his feelings and intentions—are given greater weight than his outward expressions. He may struggle to synchronize his internal passions with overt, decisive actions.

6. Synthesis of Edward’s Internal State
 • Edward experiences powerful, transformative emotions that are not readily apparent due to a practiced public reserve.
 • There is an inner tug-of-war: while his Venus in Aries propels a raw and assertive attraction, his retrograde Mars in Cancer and powerful Pluto dynamics hold him back, instilling hesitancy and inward focus.
 • His internal narrative is marked by intense idealism (Mercury and Neptune in Pisces) that may occasionally blur the lines between genuine feeling and fantasy.
 • Overall, Edward’s true thoughts and intentions are complicated by a dichotomy between direct, even impulsive attraction on one hand, and deeper, perhaps darker internal conflicts on the other. His feelings are significant and layered, yet his actions are shadowed by uncertainty and the need for self-protection.

This analysis is based solely on the horary data provided. Each indicator contributes to a picture of a man whose internal reality is deeply passionate and transformative but hampered by internal hesitations and a propensity for idealization.
